alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 04 at 5:37AM PST until January 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. .1 To 2 inches of rain has fallen in the area on top of a low elevation snow pack over the last 24 hours. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rainfall is expected today which combined with previous rains and snowmelt will create the potential for river flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect some slight pasture flooding in low-lying areas along and near the Coquille River. Cattle and other farm animals which graze on the floodplain may be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.9 feet. - The Coquille River is currently rising and should crest later today. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
